text: Nasho Kamungeremu (c. 1973 – 3 August 2007) was a Zimbabwean professional golfer and President of the Zimbabwe Professional Golfers Association (ZPGA). Kamungeremu was from Kotwa, in Mudzi. He began to play golf at school in 1984, and in 1988 he was the first black to win the Zimbabwe Junior Strokeplay. He also played in South Africa, Botswana, the United States, and Canada. In 2004 Kamungeremu was suspended from the sport for assaulting another player, but was later pardoned. In 2005 he was elected ZPGA President, and in 2007 he was re-elected. He died of a heart attack at the age of 34 on August 3, 2007, in Avenues Clinic, Harare, several hours after presiding over a tournament, and was buried in Kotwa. ==Professional wins (1)== ===Sunshine Tour wins (1)=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%;" !No.!!Date!!Tournament!!Score!!Margin of victory!!Runner-up |- |align=center|1 |30 Aug 1997 |FNB Botswana Open |−8 (72-65-68=205) |1 stroke | Marc Cayeux |} ==Team appearances== Amateur *Eisenhower Trophy (representing Zimbabwe): 1992, 1994 ==References== ==External links== * Category:Zimbabwean male golfers Category:Sportspeople from Mashonaland East Province Category:1973 births Category:2007 deaths
title: Nasho Kamungeremu
